title: First Blade
objectives: Learn proper knife grip and basic safety
instructions: Set up your cutting board with a damp cloth underneath to prevent slipping
Hold the knife with your dominant hand, pinching the blade between your thumb and forefinger
Practice the "claw" technique with your non-dominant hand to protect your fingers
Cut the carrot into 1/4-inch rounds using a smooth slicing motion
Cut the celery into similar-sized pieces
Store cut vegetables in a container for future use in soups or stir-fries
learningFocus: Basic knife handling and safety fundamentals

title: Salt Fundamentals
objectives: Learn proper seasoning techniques using only salt
instructions: Take a small piece of bread and taste it unseasoned
Add a tiny pinch of salt and taste again
Continue adding small amounts and tasting until it tastes 'better' but not 'salty'
Repeat the process with a cooked egg and steamed vegetable
Note how different foods require different amounts of salt
Practice seasoning at different stages (before, during, after cooking)
learningFocus: Understanding salt as a flavor enhancer rather than a 'flavor' itself

title: Rice Foundations
objectives: Properly measure rice and water ratios
Control heat for perfect rice cooking
instructions: Measure 1 cup of rice and rinse until water runs clear
Add rice to saucepan with 1.5-2 cups water (depending on rice type)
Bring to a boil uncovered
Once boiling, reduce heat to low and cover
Set timer according to rice type (white: 15-20 min, brown: 35-40 min)
When timer ends, remove from heat but keep covered for 5 minutes
Fluff with fork before serving
learningFocus: Proper measurement, timing, and heat management

title: Egg Essentials
objectives: Learn to recognize proper pan temperature
instructions: Place pan over medium heat and add a small amount of oil or butter
Wait until the fat is hot but not smoking (test with a drop of water - it should sizzle gently)
Crack eggs into a bowl first, then add to the pan
For sunny-side up: cook until whites are set but yolk is runny
For over-easy: flip gently when whites are set, cook 10-15 seconds more
For scrambled: whisk eggs, pour into pan, gently fold as they cook
Season with salt at the end of cooking
learningFocus: Understanding heat control and timing for egg doneness

title: Measuring Mastery
objectives: Learn proper measuring techniques for dry and wet ingredients
Practice consistent measuring for recipe accuracy
instructions: Set up measuring tools and ingredients on a clean counter
Practice measuring dry ingredients by spooning into the cup, then leveling with a knife
Practice measuring wet ingredients at eye level in a liquid measuring cup
Compare measurements across different tools to understand consistency
Practice converting between common measurements (tbsp to tsp, cups to oz)
learningFocus: Consistent measurement techniques for recipe success

title: Pantry Organization
objectives: Organize pantry staples for efficient cooking
Learn proper storage for common ingredients
instructions: Remove items from your pantry space
Group similar items together (grains, canned goods, spices, etc.)
Check expiration dates and discard expired items
Transfer items to appropriate containers for freshness
Label containers with contents and date
Arrange items by frequency of use for easy access
Create a basic inventory list of staples
learningFocus: Kitchen management and ingredient preservation

title: Vegetable Cleaning
objectives: Learn proper cleaning techniques for different vegetables
Understand which parts are edible and which should be discarded
instructions: Sort vegetables by type (root, leafy, fruit vegetables)
For leafy greens: remove damaged outer leaves, soak in cold water, drain thoroughly
For root vegetables: scrub with vegetable brush under running water
For delicate items like berries: gentle rinse and pat dry
Practice removing stems, seeds, and other inedible parts
Store cleaned vegetables properly for future use
learningFocus: Proper vegetable preparation and food safety

title: One-Pan Scramble
objectives: Combine ingredients for a complete meal
instructions: Heat pan to medium and add oil
Add firmest vegetables first (e.g., carrots)
Add remaining vegetables in order of cooking time
When vegetables are nearly done, add beaten eggs
Gently stir until eggs are set
Season throughout cooking process, tasting as you go
Serve as complete meal
learningFocus: Combining learned skills into a complete dish

title: Breakfast Toast Variations
objectives: Create multiple variations of topped toast
instructions: Toast bread to perfection (using skills from Perfect Toast quest)
Prepare 2-3 different toppings:
- Mashed avocado with salt and lemon
- Egg (fried or scrambled using Egg Essentials skills)
- Cheese (melted under broiler or microwave)
Layer components in proper order for best results
Season each variation appropriately
Arrange for appealing presentation
Taste and evaluate each variation
learningFocus: Component combination and flavor layering

title: Pantry Pasta
objectives: Create a complete meal using primarily pantry staples
Build a simple but flavorful sauce
instructions: Bring large pot of water to boil (apply proper salt amount)
Cook pasta according to package directions (testing for doneness)
While pasta cooks, prepare simple sauce using:
- Heat olive oil in pan
- Add minced garlic and red pepper flakes
- Cook until fragrant but not brown
Reserve some pasta water before draining
Combine pasta with sauce, adding pasta water as needed
Finish with grated cheese and any fresh herbs available
Adjust seasoning to taste
learningFocus: Basic sauce building and pasta cooking technique

title: Market Expedition
objectives: Visit local market or grocery store
Identify and research one unfamiliar vegetable
instructions: Visit local market or grocery produce section
Identify three vegetables you've never cooked with
For each, note appearance, texture, and label information
Ask store staff about one vegetable (preparation methods, flavor)
Purchase one new vegetable to experiment with
Research preparation methods at home
Plan which quest to incorporate it into
learningFocus: Ingredient knowledge expansion and food curiosity

title: Taste Testing Experiment
materials: Small samples of foods with different taste profiles
instructions: Gather small samples representing the five basic tastes:
- Sweet (sugar, honey)
- Salty (salt, soy sauce)
- Sour (lemon, vinegar)
- Bitter (coffee, dark chocolate)
- Umami (parmesan, mushrooms, tomato)
Taste each sample individually, noting sensations and intensity
Cleanse palate with water between samples
Try combining tastes in pairs to observe interactions
Write down descriptions and reactions for future reference
Identify which tastes you're most sensitive to
learningFocus: Flavor identification and sensory development

title: Kitchen Equipment Survey
objectives: Create a complete inventory of kitchen equipment
instructions: Remove all cooking tools and equipment from storage
Group items by function (cutting, cooking, measuring, etc.)
Clean each item properly according to its material
Note condition and functionality of each item
Create an inventory list with care instructions
Identify missing essential tools for future acquisition
Organize items for optimal workflow when returned to storage
learningFocus: Kitchen equipment knowledge and organization

title: Perfect Toast
objectives: Master proper toasting technique using different methods
Apply toppings at the right time
instructions: Slice bread evenly for consistent toasting
Try multiple toasting methods if available (toaster, pan, oven)
Monitor the toasting process - looking for golden brown color
Test different settings/times for your preferred level of doneness
Apply butter immediately after toasting for best melting
Try various simple toppings (jam, nut butter, avocado)
learningFocus: Heat monitoring and timing

title: Basic Herb Preparation
objectives: Learn to clean and dry herbs properly
Understand herb storage for maximum freshness
instructions: Remove herbs from packaging and inspect for quality
Rinse herbs under cold water and shake off excess moisture
Pat dry completely with paper towels or use a salad spinner
For leafy herbs, pick leaves from tough stems
Practice basic cutting techniques (rough chop vs. fine mince)
Store properly in paper towel and container or herb keeper
Freeze a portion with a simple method (ice cube tray with oil)
learningFocus: Herb preparation and flavor enhancement

title: Boiled Eggs Mastery
objectives: Perfect the timing for different egg consistencies
instructions: Place eggs in a single layer in a pot
Cover with cold water by 1 inch
Bring to a rolling boil
Remove from heat, cover, and let stand for varying times:
- 4 minutes for very soft boiled
- 6 minutes for soft boiled
- 9 minutes for medium
- 12 minutes for hard boiled
Prepare ice bath while eggs cook
Transfer eggs immediately to ice bath after cooking time
Let cool for 5 minutes before peeling
Practice gentle tapping and peeling technique
learningFocus: Precision timing and temperature control

title: Precision Dice
objectives: Practice uniform dicing techniques for even cooking
instructions: Position your cutting board on a stable surface
For the onion: Cut in half from root to stem
Peel the half
Make horizontal cuts parallel to the board (but not through the root)
Make vertical cuts from top to bottom
Cut across to create dice
For the carrot: Cut into 2-inch segments
Slice one side to create a flat surface
Cut into planks of equal thickness
Stack planks and cut into sticks
Cut sticks into cubes
Aim for all pieces to be approximately the same size (1/4 inch)
learningFocus: Precision cutting techniques and consistency

title: Simple Vinaigrette
objectives: Create a versatile dressing for various uses
instructions: Add 1 tablespoon vinegar to jar
Add pinch of salt and optional 1/2 teaspoon mustard
Slowly add 3 tablespoons olive oil
Secure lid and shake vigorously until emulsified
Taste and adjust seasoning as needed
Use immediately or store in refrigerator
learningFocus: Basic flavor balance and simple sauce creation

title: Heat Tamer
objectives: Control heat levels on your stovetop
Recognize visual and auditory cues for proper cooking temperature
Apply appropriate heat for different cooking processes
instructions: Place pan on medium heat and add a small amount of oil
Observe how the oil moves (it should shimmer but not smoke)
Test temperature by adding a small piece of food
Listen for the proper sizzle sound (steady but not aggressive)
Practice adjusting heat up and down
Note how quickly food cooks at different temperature levels
Practice maintaining a consistent temperature
learningFocus: Understanding heat control through sensory cues

title: Mise en Place
instructions: Select a simple recipe you plan to cook
Read the entire recipe before beginning
Gather all ingredients and tools
Measure and prep each ingredient before cooking begins
Arrange ingredients in order of use
Organize your workspace for efficient movement
Clean as you go when possible
learningFocus: Kitchen organization and preparation efficiency

title: Salad Creation
objectives: Build a balanced salad with complementary components
Apply knife skills to various ingredients
instructions: Wash and dry greens thoroughly
Prepare vegetables using appropriate cutting techniques
If using protein, prepare it properly (slice, dice, etc.)
Consider contrasting textures (crisp, soft, crunchy)
Layer ingredients attractively
Dress lightly just before serving (or serve dressing on the side)
Taste and adjust final seasoning
learningFocus: Ingredient balance and composition principles

title: Tool Assessment
instructions: List all current kitchen tools and equipment
Note condition of each item
Identify one tool that limits your cooking ability
Research potential replacements or upgrades
If possible, test a friend's version of the tool
Create plan for future tool acquisition
Organize current tools for better workflow
learningFocus: Kitchen management and tool knowledge
